author: Amanda Kinseth
title: chevron-right
text: DARLINGTON COUNTY, S.C. (WPDE) ‚Äî Families across our area are celebrating Kwanzaa, which kicked off Tuesday. Kwanzaa celebrates the values and principles of African American culture. READ MORE: [Sober NYE party at Myrtle Beach eatery invites guests to ring in 2024](https://wpde.com/news/local/dirty-myrtle-wing-company-hosts-sober-nye-party-for-those-going-through-sobriety-new-years-eve-new-year-2024-holiday-season-myrtle-beach-south-carolina-chicken-food-culinary-sober-alcohol-free-champange-toast-ball-drop) It was created by a California State University professor, Maulana Karenga, in 1966 as a way to bring people together. The seven-day holiday focuses on seven principles - unity, self-determination, responsibility, economics, purpose, creativity and faith. "January 1st, that is the day of faith. Our focus is on what is our relationship with our creator God, and then how do we bring other people to that realization. Kwanzaa means first fruits. It's really a harvest festival," said Darnell Byrd McPherson, First Steps Darlington County. You're invited to a family-friendly Kwanzaa celebration this weekend in Darlington County. It's Saturday from 11:30 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. at First Steps in Lamar.

author: Prakhya Tamraparni | National Law U. Delhi, IN
title: Assam rebels sign peace agreement with state and Indian governments
text: [www.polgeonow.com](https://www.polgeonow.com/)/ [CC BY 4.0](https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/) [Assam rebels sign peace agreement with state and Indian governments](#) The rebel United Liberation Front of Asom (ULFA), the state government of Assam, and the Indian government [signed](https://twitter.com/ANI/status/1740700744964358556?t=xxIxJ7jkvT3flBUpNajw6Q&s=19) a peace agreement on Friday, aiming to end over 40 years of insurgency. ULFA leader Arabinda Rajkhowa, Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma, and Union Minister Amit Shah were all present during the signing of the memorandum. The ULFA was formed in 1979, originally advocating and fighting for the ‚Äúrestoration of Assam‚Äôs sovereignty‚Äù or greater state autonomy. However, the death of the militant leader of the United Front in 1991 caused a division of forces in the ULFA. In 2012, the ULFA underwent a formal [split](https://www.satp.org/satporgtp/countries/india/states/assam/terrorist_outfits/ulfa.htm), and two factions emerged: the Anti-Talks faction (ULFA-ATF) and the Pro-Talks faction (ULFA-PTF). The ULFA-ATF renamed itself ULFA-Independent (ULFA-I) in 2013, and the ULFA-PTF is in talks with the government. The ULFA was banned by the Indian government in 1990, and there were several violent encounters between the Indian military and the ULFA in the following years. The Chief Minister (CM) of Assam, Himanta Biswa Sarma, [highlighted](https://www.sentinelassam.com/north-east-india-news/assam-news/assam-landmark-peace-accord-signed-with-ulfa-pro-talk-faction-683749) the importance of the memorandum in moving towards more peaceful approaches with other ‚Äúseparatist groups‚Äù in the region and ‚Äúinsurgent groups‚Äù in the state including the Bodo, Karbi, and Adivasi factions. CM Sarma reassures that the government will be successful in dissolving the organization, surrendering weapons possessed and integrating the 729 members into the ‚Äúmainstream‚Äù through this agreement. However, ULFA-I, led by Paresh Barua, was excluded from the negotiations. Assam‚Äôs sovereignty is an issue that the anti-talks ULFA-I continues to press. Members of the party have been involved in violence across the region.

author: AOL Staff
title: Four-year-old survives 22 hours in California wilderness after walking away from campsite
text: A four-year-old boy survived nearly an entire day alone in the wilderness after he wandered away from his family while they were at a campsite in central California . Christian Ramirez of Torrance, California, was camping with his family at the Rancheria campground in Lakeshore, about 70 miles outside of Fresno, when his ordeal began, KTLA reported . Christian became separated from his family on Thursday at about 10am local time. His relatives searched him for an hour but were unable to find him, so they called rescue crews, who then launched a frantic search for the boy. With much of the US in the grips of extreme heat recently, Thursday‚Äôs high in Lakeshore was 79F (26.1C) ‚Äì and the low was 40F (4.4C). A crew of more than 50 volunteers and officers searched for Christian for hours, using dogs, an aerial search, and other methods, the California news outlet ABC7 Eyewitness News reported . Christian was then in a wooded area about a quarter-mile from the campsite when, fortunately for him, his family and the search crews, members of the Tulare county search and rescue team found him at about 8am on Friday. Authorities say Christian was hungry and tired when rescuers found him after he had been missing for roughly 22 hours. But he was in good health, according to officials. The four-year-old was wearing only a T-shirt and shorts when he dealt with the overnight low temperatures in the 40s. The forest area is also home to dangerous animals, including bears and snakes. ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs a lot of things that could have gone really, really wrong with this one, and we got lucky ‚Äì the family got lucky,‚Äù Brandon Pursell of the Fresno county sheriff‚Äôs office said to ABC7. ‚ÄúThe boy is very, very fortunate to be with his family.‚Äù Upon finding Christian, rescuers gave the boy a sandwich and quickly reunited him with his parents. Christian‚Äôs successful rescue came only a day after a man was rescued after being lost in the California mountains for more than a week. Lukas McClish, 34, of Boulder Creek, California , sustained himself on creek water and wild berries after he became lost on a hike on 11 June. McClish ‚Äì who had planned to hike for only a few hours when he became lost ‚Äì was not found until 20 June after people heard his screams for help. ‚ÄúI felt comfortable the whole time I was out there ‚Äì I wasn‚Äôt worried,‚Äù McClish told KSBW in an interview published on Sunday. ‚ÄúI think it was just somebody watching over me.‚Äù

author: Reuters
title: France, Germany, UK and US Condemn Iran's Increased Uranium Enrichment
text:
WASHINGTON ‚Äî France, Germany, Britain and the United States on Thursday condemned Iran‚Äôs increase in its production rate of highly enriched uranium of up to 60% purity, close to the level used for nuclear weapons fuel.
In a joint statement, the allies made no mention of any consequences Iran could face for the production hike but called for its reversal and said they remained "committed to a diplomatic solution" to the feud over Tehran's nuclear program.
"The production of high-enriched uranium by Iran has no credible civilian justification," the statement said. "These decisions ... represent reckless behavior in a tense regional context."
Since the start of Israel's offensive against Gaza's ruling Hamas militants, Iran-backed proxies have increased their attacks on shipping in the Red Sea and on U.S. troops in Iraq and Syria, sharply increasing tensions in the region.
Israel launched its operation in response to Hamas' deadly October 7 rampage into Israel.
The U.N. nuclear watchdog, the International Atomic Energy Agency, or IAEA, said in a report on Tuesday that Iran had reversed a monthslong slowdown in the production rate of highly enriched uranium up to 60% purity.
"We condemn this action, which adds to the unabated escalation of Iran‚Äôs nuclear program," the joint statement said.
Iran on Wednesday dismissed the IAEA report as "nothing new" and said it was running its program "according to the rules."
Tehran already has enough uranium of 60% purity, if enriched to 90%, to make three nuclear bombs, according to the IAEA's theoretical definition.
Iran has denied seeking nuclear weapons.
Britain, France and Germany remain parties to the 2015 deal designed to prevent Iran from developing nuclear weapons. Former U.S. President Donald Trump reneged on the accord in 2018, after which Iran gradually violated its strictures.

author: Adam Kelnhofer
title: Dept. of Natural Resources: Experience winter in a new light with DNR candlelight events
text:
Looking for some post-holiday winter fun? Spend some time in the great outdoors at one of several candlelight events happening across Wisconsin! These events kick off on Jan. 6, 2024 and are scheduled at different locations through March 2024.
These free-to-low cost events typically begin around sunset and offer a variety of ways to enjoy the winter scenery after dark, including hiking, snowshoeing and cross-country skiing. Many will include activities such as bonfires, hot chocolate, cider and other refreshments available for sale or by donation, and some will have open warming shelters.
Although the amount of gear needed varies, warm clothing with layers is recommended for all events. Trekking poles are optional. A headlamp or flashlight is recommended. Some properties may have other equipment, such as snowshoes or an outdoor track chair, available to check out. Contact the property to see what is available and to make reservations.
Most properties will require a 2024
Wisconsin state park admission fee and/or a state trail pass unless otherwise noted. A state park daily admission pass may be available to check out at participating libraries.
2024 Candlelight Events
Additional events may be added.
Jan. 6

Jan. 13

- Rib Mountain State Park Candlelight Snowshoe Hike

March 9

Thanks to the
Friends groups of the parks, who organize many of the events and provide many of the volunteers to make these events possible.
Find the full and additional details on the
DNR‚Äôs Event Calendar.
Some events are weather dependent; visitors are encouraged to check the DNR Events Calendar or call properties directly to confirm if an event will be held.

ATV/UTV Riders: Beware Of Winter Conditions
Many of the state‚Äôs trails have yet to be covered in snow, but just because a winter road or trail is legally open for riding doesn‚Äôt mean it‚Äôs safe. Frost, ice and fresh snow can cause slippery conditions in a hurry.
In 2023,
Here are a few more safety tips to keep in mind when operating your off-highway vehicles during winter:
Wisconsin law requires ATV and UTV operators born on or after Jan. 1, 1988, who are at least 12 years old for an ATV (and at least 16 years old for UTV) must complete an ATV safety certification course to operate in Wisconsin (exception: on private property owned by operator‚Äôs immediate family). These safety courses can be taken online or in person.
Wisconsin law also requires every operator involved in a crash incident to report the incident without delay to law enforcement officials. Operators must submit a

author: Namita Singh
title: Defense Minister Rajnath Singh dedicates 29 bridges and six roads to strengthen the safety at borders | India News - News9live
text: Dehradun: The state and union territories, located on the borders, got an infrastructural boost as defense minister Rajnath Singh inaugurated 35 projects including six roads and 29 bridges. Uttarakhand, Jammu & Kashmir, Ladakh, Himachal Pradesh, Sikkim, Arunachal Pradesh and Mizoram are among these states and UTs. Border road Organisation has played a key role in construction of these projects costing around Rs. 670 crores. Jammu & Kashmir gets maximum bridges With ten bridges and one road in Jammu & Kashmir, Ladakh has six bridges and three roads. Along with this, 3 bridges in Uttarakhand, 01 bridge in Himachal Pradesh, 02 roads in Sikkim, 08 bridges in Arunachal Pradesh and 1 bridge is in Mizoram. In the state of Uttarakhand, Dhak Bridge and Bhapkund Bridge on the Joshimath-Malari road connecting the India-China border and Rimkhim Garh Bridge on the Sumna-Rimkhim motor road, all three bridges have been built by Shivalik Project at a cost of Rs 33.24 crore. These bridges will help in making transportation easier in border areas. Defense Minister lauded the BRO Appreciating the service of the Border Roads Organization (BRO), the defense minister said that timely completion of any project has been possible due to the commitment of the organization. He also called for working in an environmentally friendly manner with the mantra of maximum national security and welfare. The defense minister lauded BRO for strengthening the country's border infrastructure. Rajnath Singh also made special mention of the contribution of BRO in the recently launched Silkyara Tunnel Operation to rescue stranded laborers in Uttarakhand. The government is committed to development of border areas Defensee minister said that under the leadership of PM Modi, the government is committed to the development of border areas keeping in mind the security needs of the country. ‚ÄúWe do not consider these areas as buffer zones. They are part of our mainstream‚Äù. CM Dhami congratulated Defense Minister Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami expressed his gratitude on the inauguration of development projects of border areas. The Chief Minister said that under the leadership of Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi, work on big projects has been started considering the strategic, religious and environmental importance of the state. Schemes like Char-Dham All Weather Road, Rishikesh-Karnprayag Railway Line, Frontier Area Development Project and Parvatmala are important from the point of view of development as well as security. The Chief Minister congratulated and congratulated the entire team of BRO for giving impetus to the infrastructure development work in the border areas.

author: Alicea James
title: Cory Wharton reflects on one-year milestone of daughter‚Äôs open-heart surgery ‚Äî reveals she has one more to go
text:
Cory Wharton is happy to welcome the New Year because 2023 started as a very ‚Äúdark time‚Äù in his life.
The Teen Mom OG alum shared a reflective post on social media and revealed that one year ago today, his youngest daughter, Maya Grace Wharton, underwent open-heart surgery.
He also admitted that the one-year-old isn‚Äôt out of the woods just yet, as she‚Äôs scheduled for another surgery in a year or so.
Maya is the third child for Cory, who has another daughter, Mila, with wife Taylor Selfridge, and a six-year-old daughter, Ryder, with Teen Mom: The Next Chapter star, Cheyenne Floyd.
Cory shared the happy news in March of 2022 that Taylor was pregnant with their second child, and in June, they welcomed Maya into the world.
Several days later, Cory and Taylor revealed that
she was born with Tricuspid Atresia ‚Äî a rare form of congenital heart disease ‚Äî and underwent open heart surgery the first week of her life.
At seven months old, Maya underwent her second open-heart surgery but
suffered complications and spent some time in the ICU.
Thankfully, the toddler is doing much better today, and her parents are grateful for that.
Cory Wharton‚Äôs daughter Maya reaches the one-year milestone of her second open-heart surgery
Little Maya has been through a lot since birth, but the tiny red-haired beauty is a fighter.
Her dad Cory shared a post on Instagram to mark the one-year milestone of the toddler‚Äôs second open-heart surgery as he reflected on 2023.
The image showed little Maya clad in a red outfit, surrounded by a collage of stunning black and white images from the past year.
‚ÄúToday, marks 1 Year from Maya‚Äôs Open Heart Surgery ‚ù§Ô∏è,‚Äù wrote Cory. ‚ÄúI learned so much throughout that process.‚Äù
The 31-year-old stressed the importance of health and revealed that watching the kids in the children‚Äôs hospital with a smile on their faces despite their circumstances left a memorable impression.
‚ÄúReally made me look into my life and what‚Äôs important. I learned that I have a great support system around me, and most importantly, a great partner in this,‚Äù reasoned Cory.
Teen Mom OG alum Cory Wharton reflects on a ‚Äòdark time‚Äô in 2023
In his lengthy message, Cory had some words for his youngest daughter, saying ‚ÄúMaya, I know that was a dark time in our lives, but you got through it.‚Äù
He also revealed that Maya will have to do another heart surgery, and then all should be well.
Before ending the post, Cory thanked the CHD (Congenital Heart Defects) community that sent supportive messages and DMs and noted, ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a storm that will pass! You will get through it I promise!‚Äù
For Maya, he added, ‚ÄúHappy Heartiversary ‚ù§Ô∏è My Lil redhead, Love you more then you‚Äôll ever know üòò.‚Äù
Teen Mom: The Next Chapter is currently on hiatus.
